message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.GR, cs.MG, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with approximating convex bodies by convex polytopes, which is a fundamental problem in discrete geometry. This problem is closely related to computational geometry, which falls under the cs.CG sub-category. The paper also involves analyzing the combinatorial complexity of the approximating polytope, which is a topic in both computational geometry and combinatorics. Therefore, cs.DS (discrete structures) and cs.GR (graph theory) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also uses width-based variants of certain geometric structures, which is a topic in numerical analysis (cs.NA). Finally, the paper involves a novel combination of both new and old ideas, which could potentially fall under the cs.MG (machine learning) sub-category.
